text: Piers 3 and 5 North known as the Girard Group on Philadelphia's Delaware River waterfront were built by the City of Philadelphia and named in honor of Stephen Girard who built wharfs in this area in the early nineteenth century. Each of the two piers contains warehouse space of about . The Benjamin Franklin Bridge is one block north of the northern pier.George E. Thomas, [ NRHP Nomination - Girard Group] ==References== Category:Buildings and structures on the National Register of Historic Places in Pennsylvania Category:Buildings and structures completed in 1923 Category:Buildings and structures in Philadelphia Category:Penn's Landing Category:National Register of Historic Places in Philadelphia
title: Girard Group
